description: President Donald Trump sought to rein in independent federal agencies in an executive order Tuesday that aims to curb the ability of some of Washington’s most powerful regulators to oversee banks and other companies.
title: Trump Tightens Grip on Bank, M&A Regulators in Latest Order

description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio told European allies that the Trump administration would keep its Russia sanctions in place at least until a deal to end the Ukraine conflict is reached, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Rubio Says US Won’t Lift Russia Sanctions Before Ukraine Deal

description: Chevron Corp.’s ability to continue exporting crude from Venezuela is under review, President Donald Trump said, signaling an openness to tighter restraints on the oil giant’s operations in the South American country.
title: Trump Says Chevron’s Venezuela Oil Exports Under Review

description: Hamas said it’s ready to exchange its remaining Israeli hostages all at once with Palestinian prisoners during the Gaza truce’s second phase as a step leading to a “permanent ceasefire” and the full withdrawal of Israel’s forces from the enclave.
title: Hamas Offers to Free All Hostages for Israel’s Gaza Withdrawal

description: US Treasury official Shannon Ding will serve as the acting representative for the US on the International Monetary Fund’s board, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Treasury Official Ding to Become Acting IMF Board Representative for US

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House and politics reporter Gregory Korte examines a mystery around the leadership and status of DOGE. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Elon Musk Is DOGE’s Frontman But He Doesn’t Actually Work There

description: President Donald Trump signed an order that directs his team to produce policy recommendations to lower health plan and out-of-pocket costs for in vitro fertilization, amid criticism that his abortion policies would reduce access to the treatment.
title: Trump Signs Order Exploring Ways to Lower Cost of IVF Treatments

description: A federal judge denied a request to temporarily bar Elon Musk and the Trump administration’s “government efficiency” team from accessing internal systems and removing employees at multiple US agencies, handing a win to President Donald Trump over one of his signature initiatives.
title: Judge Denies Bid to Halt Musk Access to US Agencies for Now

description: Japan’s largest opposition party wants to use the Bank of Japan’s exchange-traded funds to help cover the cost of making high school education free as part of the normalization of monetary policy, according to a party official.
title: Japan Opposition Party Eyes BOJ’s ETFs to Pay for Free Schooling

description: Senate Republicans are considering a massive sale of radio spectrum intended to generate billions of dollars to help pay for President Donald Trump’s agenda and free up airwaves for wireless broadband.
title: GOP Senators Weigh Selling Radio Spectrum to Reap $100 Billion

description: The acting commissioner of the Social Security Administration and her top deputy have left following a confrontation with Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency team over access to data on 70 million beneficiaries, according to people familiar with the moves.
title: Top Social Security Officials Exit After Clash With Musk’s DOGE

description: The European Union is working on an initiative to provide Ukraine with additional military support as soon as possible this year, according to a document seen by Bloomberg  News.
title: EU Floats Initiative to Provide Ukraine More Military Support

description: The head of a US whistleblower-protection agency urged the US Supreme Court to let him stay in his job for the time being, saying his firing by President Donald Trump would weaken the office at an “especially unfortunate moment.”
title: US Supreme Court Urged to Keep Pause on Trump Firing of Whistleblower Agency Head

description: Ukraine’s mineral wealth has been thrown into the spotlight as US President Donald Trump looks to seize control of its resources in return for military support. Yet very little is actually known about what’s up for grabs.
title: Trump Wants Ukraine’s Minerals. But What Exactly Is Up for Grabs?

description: Elon Musk’s mission to shrink the size of the US government has put a spotlight on an obscure federal office whose work directly touches nearly every American. The US Treasury Department’s Bureau of the Fiscal Service processes billions of payments worth trillions of dollars each year, acting as the central clearinghouse for almost everything the federal government spends money on, from Social Security payments and veterans benefits to grants for state governments. As such, BFS has become a foca
title: How the Treasury Payment System DOGE Wants to Control Works

description: France is planning to hold a second meeting on Ukraine and European security on Wednesday, inviting countries not present at an earlier meeting this week, two people familiar with the matter said, confirming an earlier Reuters report.
title: France to Convene Second Meeting on Ukraine on Wednesday

description: Municipal bond investors are being advised to scale back positions in credits that receive significant sums of money from the US government, as President Donald Trump seeks to affect state and local policy by withholding federal funding.
title: Trump Clawbacks of FEMA Aid Present Risk to Muni Bonds, MMA Says

description: Homeland Security’s inspector general had previously urged the immediate removal of detainees from the facility due to “critical staffing shortages.”
title: Whistleblowers Allege Fraud, Cover-Up at ICE Detention Center

description: The Solana cryptocurrency sank to the lowest level since early November as the president of Argentina became embroiled in a scandal involving a memecoin launched on the token’s blockchain.
title: Argentina Scandal Fuels Selloff on Favorite Memecoin Platform

description: The Trump administration is planning to lay off at least 40% of the workers at the federal agency that provides mortgage insurance on loans for people who otherwise wouldn’t qualify for one, according to two sources familiar with the agency’s plans.
title: Federal Mortgage Insurer to Lay Off Nearly Half Its Workforce

description: Polish Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski said the European Union needs to show more solidarity on defense spending in the face of “mixed signals” from the US.
title: Poland Urges EU Solidarity on Defense Spending After US Shock

description: Uganda deployed more forces to eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, highlighting the growing risk of a widening conflict in the unrest-prone, mineral-rich region.
title: Ugandan Forces Deploy in Eastern Congolese City to Quell Unrest

description: The Trump administration’s antitrust enforcers will follow Biden-era merger review rules, disappointing critics who had hoped for a rollback of the requirements.
title: Trump Antitrust Enforcers to Keep Biden-Era Merger Review Rules

description: The National Science Foundation fired 168 workers to comply with President Donald Trump’s executive order, the latest in a series of layoffs throughout the US government as the Trump administration seeks to shrink federal agencies.
title: National Science Foundation Fires 168 Workers on Trump’s Order

description: The US and Russia signaled a determination to remove sanctions imposed over President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine as part of talks to end the conflict, opening up another point of tension with European allies that want the restrictions to remain in place.
title: US, Russia Signal Sanctions Are Up for Debate in Ukraine Talks

description: A plan by a group of Sudanese political parties to form a parallel government was delayed until the end of the week to allow the addition of another armed group, according to an official involved in the discussions.
title: Sudan Coalition Delays Signing of Parallel-Government Agreement

description: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said the US government’s plan to remove the existing Palestinian population from Gaza and rebuild the devastated enclave into a “Riviera” is “stupid” and “will lead to nowhere.”
title: Iran’s Khamenei Says US Gaza Plan Is ‘Stupid’ and Bound to Fail

description: Elon Musk — whose name has become nearly synonymous with the cost-cutting mission of the newly formed “Department of Government Efficiency” — doesn’t actually work for it, the White House said.
title: Musk Advises Trump But Doesn’t Work for DOGE, White House Says

description: President Javier Milei stumbled in his bid to downplay his role in a crypto scandal in which he touted a memecoin that later crashed, with fallout spreading to Argentine assets after investors returned from a US holiday.
title: Milei’s Crypto Defense Backfires After TV Interview

description: Populist leaders in Bulgaria and Slovakia dismissed the option of sending peacekeeping troops to Ukraine as the European Union struggles to find its place in peace talks.
title: Populist Leaders in East Europe Won’t Send Soldiers to Ukraine

description: The federal judge overseeing the corruption case against New York City Mayor Eric Adams has scheduled a hearing on the Justice Department’s request to drop the charges.
title: Eric Adams Judge Sets Hearing on DOJ Move to Drop Corruption Case

description: The US and Russia agreed to more talks on resolving the war in Ukraine and finding ways to work together on other international issues, but set no date for a summit meeting between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin.
title: US and Russia Agree to More Talks on Ukraine, Set No Summit Date

description: Exports surged last week, but discharging cargoes from sanctioned tankers remains a problem
title: New Ships and Cargo Transfers Boost Russia’s Crude Oil Flows

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is casting around for scraps of second-hand information as officials from the US and Russia discuss the future of his country.
title: Zelenskiy Out in Cold as US Discusses Ukraine’s Fate With Russia

description: The Group of Seven is considering collectively tightening or adapting an oil price cap on Russian petroleum in an effort to reduce Moscow’s revenues as the war in Ukraine continues.
title: G-7 Allies Weigh Tightening Russian Oil Price Cap to Hurt Moscow

description: Postmaster General Louis DeJoy asked the board overseeing the US Postal Service to begin the succession process, paving the way for his departure after a turbulent run of almost five years leading the agency.
title: USPS Begins Succession Process as Postmaster General Plans Exit

description: It’s been an unusual start to the year for Colombian stocks.
title: Leftist’s Flop in Colombia Sparks Wild Election-Bet Stock Rally

description: A British couple arrested in central Iran have been formally charged with espionage on behalf of “hostile and Western countries,” the state-run Mizan Online reported, citing the Iranian judiciary.
title: Iran’s Judiciary Charges British Couple With Spying for West

description: The European Union said it hasn’t made any specific offer yet to reduce tariffs on imported US cars as it works to avoid a trade confrontation with President Donald Trump.
title: EU Denies Making Offer to US on Lowering Its Auto Tariffs

description: The UK must urgently re-arm as part of a commitment to step up European security, Defence Secretary John Healey said, announcing the establishment of a unit within his department to oversee £20 billion ($25 billion) of military spending.
title: UK Plans FTSE Firm-Style Unit for £20 Billion Defense Spending

description: Singapore’s 2025 budget is expected to boost lending, consumer and green energy sectors, while providing a push to the city-state’s stock market.
title: Here Are the Key Winners From Singapore’s Election-Year Budget

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.It’s starting to feel like the old superpower days for the Kremlin in relations with the US.
title: Trump Brings Putin in From the Cold With Ukraine Talks

description: Israel will start negotiations on the second stage of a ceasefire with Palestinian militant group Hamas, Israeli Foreign Affairs Minister Gideon Sa’ar said, adding he expects talks to begin as early as next week.
title: Israel to Start Talks on Phase 2 Ceasefire Deal, Minister Says

description: The Israeli military retained five outposts just over its northern border but has otherwise withdrawn from Lebanon in keeping with Tuesday’s deadline, Lebanon’s state-run National News Agency reported.
title: Lebanese Media Confirms Israel Troops Remain in Five Outposts

description: Germany holds a snap election on Sunday following an acrimonious campaign in which the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) challenged the country’s postwar tradition of moderate, consensual politics.
title: What’s in Store for Germany as Far-Right AfD Eyes Big Election Gains?

description: Singapore plans to invest about S$1 billion ($744.8 million) for a new R&D semiconductor facility that will provide “great tools for researchers and industry partners” to boost innovation, according to Prime Minister Lawrence Wong.
title: Singapore Flags Investment Plans From Chips to Energy in Budget

description: The Philippines said a Chinese Navy helicopter carried out “dangerous flight maneuvers” near its own aircraft over the South China Sea.
title: Philippines Accuses Chinese Chopper of ‘Dangerous’ Maneuvers

description: Privately-run terminals in China have taken deliveries from US-sanctioned oil tankers, suggesting that a region that is home to the country’s largest buyers of Iranian and Russian crude is finding ways to circumvent the reluctance of larger port operators.
title: China’s Private Berths Emerge as Hotspots for Russia, Iran Oil

description: South Africa’s government has drafted an early retirement offer for civil servants, part of an effort to reduce its wage bill, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: South Africa Readies Early Retirement Plan for State Workers

description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra called for “closer” cooperation between fiscal and monetary policymakers to shore up growth, a day after data showed Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy missed growth target last year.
title: Thai PM Calls for Greater Policy Coordination After Growth Miss

description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan on Tuesday will step up his call for the UK’s central government to seek a closer relationship with the European Union to act as a “counterweight” to the international upheaval presented by US President Donald Trump.
title: London’s Khan Calls for Closer EU Ties in Face of Trump Tariffs

description: Top US and Russian officials are to meet in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday to discuss how to end the war in Ukraine, without anyone from Kyiv taking part and as Europe struggles to respond to the rapid pace of events.
title: Trump, Putin Teams to Talk in Saudi on Ukraine as Europe Fumes

description: For the full experience visit: German Election Set to Shrink World’s Largest Parliament
title: German Election Set to Shrink World’s Largest Parliament

description: An expansion of the US's biggest strategic critical-minerals project in Africa is at risk.
title: Trump Aid Freeze Risks $1 Billion African Minerals Project

description: A group of lawyers and private citizens on Tuesday asked the Philippine Supreme Court to nullify the impeachment complaint against Vice President Sara Duterte, saying it didn’t follow the process under the constitution.
title: Philippine VP Duterte’s Supporters Ask Court to Void Impeachment

description: The Marcos and Duterte families dominate politics in the Philippines, and elections in the country can be as much a battle of personalities and factional interests as of policy.
title: Why Philippines Vice President Sara Duterte Faces Impeachment Trial

description: Emmanuel Macron held talks separately with Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskiy on aligning with the US after the French president spearheaded an effort to bring Europe to the table for discussions on ending Russia’s war on Ukraine.
title: Macron Seeks to Align Europe, Ukraine With Trump on Peace Talks

description: President Javier Milei spoke out for the first time about a cryptocurrency scandal that’s dented his reputation in Argentina, triggering lawsuits and even calls for his impeachment.
title: Milei Denies Wrongdoing in His First Defense of Crypto Debacle
